business.headline: Bajaj Finance share price crashes 8%: What's behind today's slide?Shares of Bajaj Finance crashed nearly 8% today after solid earnings were overshadowed by a trimmed growth outlook and rising asset stress.

Want better SIP returns? Follow the 10-7-10 mantra, says expertSIP investors often look for the magic formula to grow wealth faster. According to an expert, the 10-7-10 mantra may be the closest thing to one — a simple, disciplined approach that can potentially boost long-term returns.

Government updates pension rules: Parents must file this document for 75% benefitParents receiving family pension from the government must now file this key document every year to keep the 75% benefit. The revision is part of a new effort to reduce errors and incorrect payouts.

Pine Labs IPO closes today: Is it worth betting on for listing gains?The Rs 3,899.91 crore IPO is a book-built issue, consisting of a fresh issue of 9.41 crore shares worth Rs 2,080 crore and an offer for sale (OFS) of 8.23 crore shares worth Rs 1,819.91 crore.

Mutual fund SIPs vs direct stocks: Where should young professionals bet?For young professionals, the lure of direct stocks, instant control, multi-bagger dreams, and social-media bravado is understandable. Yet four decades of global and Indian evidence reveal a sobering pattern: discipline and diversification, not adrenaline and instinct, drive enduring wealth creation.

Tata Motors CV arm to list on November 12: What investors should knowTata Motors' decade-long restructuring reaches its final stage as its commercial vehicles arm lists on November 12. What this means for investors, share allotments, and how trading will begin?

Bajaj Finance share price falls 7% after Q2 results. Should you buy the dip?Bajaj Finance shares plunged nearly 7% after Q2 results showed solid profit growth but weaker guidance and rising asset stress. With valuations still rich, is this a buying opportunity?
Sensex, Nifty flat despite positive global sentiment, Q2 earningsThe S&P BSE Sensex was down by 242.13 points to 83,293.22, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 72.35 points to 25,502.00 as of 9:32 am.

Groww IPO listing: Strong debut or muted opening on cards? Check what GMP saysThe parent company of Groww, Billionbrains Garage Ventures Ltd, saw massive investor interest during the subscription window. Groww allotment was finalised on November 10.

Not every IPO is a jackpot: How to know if an IPO is really worth your moneyMany retail investors still go by hype, brand names, and subscription figures rather than understanding whether the issue is actually worth investing in.

PhysicsWallah IPO opens today: Should you subscribe? Here's what GMP indicatePhysicsWallah's Rs 3,480 crore IPO consists of a fresh issue of 28.44 crore shares worth Rs 3,100 crore and an offer for sale (OFS) of 3.49 crore shares worth Rs 380 crore.

Think missing an EMI is harmless? The impact can last yearsMost borrowers don't plan to miss an EMI, yet life can get in the way. But what feels like a small slip today can turn into a long-term hurdle when you need credit the most.

It's not EMIs, it's FOMO: The real reason Indians can't save, says expertIt's not monthly EMIs draining Indian wallets, it's the fear of missing out. From vacations to gadgets and impulse buys, FOMO is quietly overtaking financial discipline, says an expert, making saving feel optional rather than essential.

Sensex, Nifty end higher despite profit booking; Infosys leads gainsThe S&P BSE Sensex rose 319.07 points to close at 83,535.35, while the NSE Nifty 50 gained 82.05 points to settle at 25,574.35. Most sectoral indices also finished in the green, led by information technology, finance and metals.

Should property be a part of your long-term investment portfolio?With prices rising and rental yields improving, more Indians are turning to property as a long-term wealth investment. But should real estate really be part of your investment portfolio? Read on to find out.
Did Lenskart's high IPO valuation leave investors with no profit?Lenskart shares listed at Rs 395 on the NSE and Rs 390 on the BSE, both below the IPO issue price of Rs 402.

Selling less, earning more: Why India's real estate is earning more from lessIn FY25, around 4.22 lakh homes were sold across the top seven cities, with a total sales value of Rs 5.59 lakh crore. In FY26, ANAROCK projects this number to rise to Rs 6.65 lakh crore.

What is 'Digital Gold' and why has Sebi issued a warning?Sebi has warned investors about risks in unregulated digital gold. Experts say the move aims to protect users as India readies tighter rules for tokenised assets, so what exactly is digital gold?

Noida's retail boom: These 2 mega infra projects are driving mall growthThe Noida area has become a preferred place for retail investors and mall developers due to the proximity of expressway connectivity and the airport's vicinity.

Groww IPO allotment out: Here's how to check on BSE, NSEThe parent company of Groww, Billionbrains Garage Ventures Ltd, saw massive investor interest during the subscription window. With the allotment now underway, here's how you can find out if you've secured a piece of the company before its market debut.

entertainment.headline: Vijay's Jana Nayagan sets trade abuzz: Film nears Rs 400 crore in pre-release deals With two months to go before its scheduled release, Thalapathy Vijay's final film 'Jana Nayagan' has broken records in pre-release business, drawing significant attention from industry insiders and fans alike.

Nora Fatehi calls Shreya Ghoshal walking autotune on American podcast Nora Fatehi has urged those new to Bollywood music to listen to Shreya Ghoshal's songs. The actor also called the singer a 'walking autotune' on a recent podcast.

KISS guitarist Ace Frehley's cause of death revealed Singer Ace Frehley, renowned guitarist and founding member of the rock band KISS, died at the age of 74 after sustaining fatal head injuries in his studio. The official cause of death was confirmed as blunt force trauma to the head following a fall, and his death has been classified as accidental by medical authorities.

Farhan Akhtar shares throwback incident with Sridevi that could've ended his career Farhan Akhtar recalled a nerve-racking incident from his early days as a film assistant, when Sridevi slipped during a shoot on the sets of 'Lamhe'. The veteran actor's grace and kindness in handling the situation left a lasting impact on him, one he says he'll always be grateful for.

Red Fort blast: Raveena Tandon to Thalapathy Vijay, celebs offer condolences Celebrities including Raveena Tandon, Thaapathy Vijay, and Sidharth Malhotra, among others, offered their condolences to the families of those who lost their lives in a massive blast near Delhi's Red Fort Metro Station on November 11.

Nayanthara, Vignesh Shivan and Sreeleela go on spiritual visit to Ujjain temples Nayanthara, Vignesh Shivan, and Sreeleela were seen visiting prominent temples in Ujjain, Madhya Pradesh, where they also blessed a newlywed couple during their spiritual tour.

Haq box office Day 4: Yami Gautam, Emraan Hashmi's film nears Rs 10 crore mark The film 'Haq', starring Yami Gautam and Emraan Hashmi, continues to perform well at the Indian box office, with collections crossing Rs 1 crore on its fourth day. The movie is inspired by the legal battle of Shah Bano Begum.

Singer Palak Muchhal enters Guinness records for funding 3,800 heart surgeries Bollywood singer Palak Muchhal has been honoured by the Guinness Book of World Records for raising funds to help over 3,800 underprivileged children receive heart surgeries.

BB 19: Abhishek Bajaj on bond with Ashnoor, says Pranit felt threatened by him Abhishek Bajaj shares his feelings after eviction from 'Bigg Boss 19'. He opens up about                                                                                   a special bond with Ashnoor Kaur and discusses the strategic nature of his exit.

Jonas Brothers open up about sibling teasing, say it never caused chaos The Jonas Brothers discussed their familial bond and approach to working together during a recent Good Morning America appearance, sharing insights into their relationship and hinting at upcoming projects including a Christmas film and a return to the Camp Rock franchise.

AR Rahman under fire for collaborating with POCSO-accused choreographer Jani AR Rahman has drawn criticism for collaborating with choreographer Jani Master amid sexual harassment allegations. The controversy raises questions about selective accountability in the film industry.

Kanye West's strict rules for wife Bianca Censori spark debate on control Singer Kanye West reportedly enforces a range of personal rules for his wife, Bianca Censori, focusing on her diet, exercise, and appearance, drawing public attention and debate about control and self-expression in their marriage.

Jessica Alba's Honest Renovations renewed for season 4 at Roku Actors Jessica Alba and Lizzy Mathis will continue their home transformation series as Roku announces a fourth season of 'Honest Renovations' and a new holiday special set to premiere in 2026.

Dharmendra: Bollywood's eternal hero who loves like a poet and lives like a legend Veteran actor Dharmendra, the legendary 'He-Man of Bollywood', enjoys a six-decade legacy that defines heroism, love, and humility in Indian cinema. From 'Phool Aur Patthar' to 'Sholay' and 'Satyakam', his journey is one of grit and grace -- a life of both stardom and dreams.
Dharmendra responding to treatment and is recovering: Hema Malini Veteran actor Dharmendra is responding to treatment and is recovering, according to his family.

Bigg Boss 19 Episode 78: Amaal picks on Tanya, warns Farrhana against her Episode 78 of 'Bigg Boss 19' saw rising tensions among the housemates, with emotional reactions following Abhishek's eviction, disputes over household tasks, and shifting alliances leading to heated confrontations.

SRK, son Aryan and Govinda visit Dharmendra at Mumbai hospital. Watch videos Dharmendra has been admitted to Breach Candy Hospital in Mumbai this week. Shah Rukh Khan, Aryan Khan, Govinda, and Ameesha Patel, visited the hospital, reflecting the close bonds within the film fraternity during the veteran actor's hospitalisation.

The Girlfriend: Rashmika Mandanna shreds veil of patriarchy for every woman 'The Girlfriend' showcases Rashmika Mandanna's compelling portrayal of a woman breaking free from patriarchal chains.  The film highlights the subtle yet pervasive impact of abuse and the courage needed to reclaim one's identity.

Oscar Isaac says he'll return to Star Wars only if Disney doesn't succumb to fascism Actor Oscar Isaac has commented on his willingness to return to the Star Wars franchise, clarifying his previous remarks about Disney in light of the recent suspension of Jimmy Kimmel from ABC.

general news.headline: Nithari killings accused to walk free as Supreme Court acquits him in last caseNithari killings: This was the 13th case against Nithari killings accused Surendra Koli. He has already been acquitted in 12 previous cases.

Asim Munir's military coup in Pakistan, without the militaryThough Pakistan has seen coups and military dictators, the coup being staged by army chief Asim Munir is unprecedented. Through the 27th Constitutional Amendment, Munir is getting sweeping powers. The "constitutional coup" would dismantle Pakistan's remaining democratic safeguards and permanently alter its civil-military balance.
Dharmendra responding to treatment and is recovering: Hema MaliniVeteran actor Dharmendra is responding to treatment and is recovering, according to his family.

Dr Umar panicked after Faridabad arrests, acted in haste: Sources on Delhi blastPreliminary intelligence reports claimed the car was rigged with explosives before being driven into the crowded area. The car blew up around 6:52 pm, triggering a fire that engulfed nearby vehicles, killing 9 people.

Video: The moment Red Fort car blast was captured on YouTuber's cameraA high-intensity explosion shook the national capital on Monday evening when a slow-moving Hyundai i20 car exploded at a traffic signal near the Red Fort during peak hours. The powerful blast killed at least nine people and left dozens injured, gutting several vehicles and sparking widespread panic in the crowded area. A video, captured on the camera of a YouTuber, showed people running for their lives as the deafening blast reverberated meters away, with many screaming, "Run! Run!" amid the chaos.

They'll love us again: Trump hints at tariff cuts in fair trade deal with IndiaThe US President said that discussions with India have made significant progress and both sides are edging closer to a balanced agreement. He also said the US would eventually bring down tariffs on India.

GRAP-3 pollution curbs in Delhi-NCR as air quality index enters severe categoryDelhi-NCR's air quality worsened to the 'severe' category again on Tuesday, triggering curbs on non-essential construction, older vehicles, and in-person classes for younger students.

Bihar Phase 2 sees 31% turnout till 11 am, focus on 'decider' Seemanchal region Live UpdatesBihar elections Phase 2: Several crucial seats from the regions of Magadh, Champaran and Seemanchal, widely known as a decider for every state election, are seeing voting today.

Indian-origin Siddhant Awasthi exits Tesla, rose from intern to Cybertruck chiefSiddhant Awasthi's leadership coincided with significant milestones and challenges for the Cybertruck. Between November 2023 and early 2024, 46,096 Cybertrucks were produced, according to US recall filings. The Cybertruck also faced product recalls and sales difficulties, with Tesla offering discounts on inventory vehicles.

Elon Musk asks Grok to identify image of Lord Ganesha. See AI chatbot's replyElon Musk shared a post featuring his AI chatbot, Grok, identifying an image of Lord Ganesha. When asked to explain what it saw, the chatbot's detailed response impressed users online.

2025 Hyundai Venue review: Time for the Brezza, Sonet and Nexon to be afraid?Hyundai has refreshed the Venue with a new design, upgraded interiors, added tech features and improved safety, ready to take on strong rivals in the sub-4 metre SUV segment. On paper, the Venue seems a promising option, but how is it to drive, let's find out.

Ammonium nitrate, detonators used for high-impact Red Fort blastRed Fort attack: The fidayeen-style attack at one of the country's tourist hotspots is believed to have been carried out by one Dr Mohammad Umar, a member of the Faridabad-based terror module that was busted last week.

Bengal tea seller buys dream scooter for daughter with coins he saved over 4 yearsThe tea shop owner arrived at a scooter showroom with a drum full of small coins he had saved for four years for his daughter's dream ride.

Delhi blast: What is Ammonium-Nitrate Fuel-Oil, and why is it so deadly?The critical feature of detonation is that this chemical reaction propagates as a supersonic shock wave rather than a subsonic burn, which means energy is released extremely fast, in microseconds, creating a powerful shock front.

The woman who made India's first anti-epilepsy drug and changed the face of chemistryAsima Chatterjee became India's first woman to earn a D.Sc. in chemistry, pioneering plant-based medicines. Her work bridged traditional Ayurveda and modern science, overcoming gender bias and inspiring future generations.

Sergio Gor takes oath as US envoy; Trump says he will strengthen ties with IndiaPraising India as "one of the world's oldest civilisations" and "the largest country in the world," Trump said he was confident that Sergio Gor would strengthen the partnership between the two largest democracies.

sports.headline: Liverpool face uphill task in Premier League title race after City loss: Andy Robertson Liverpool defender Andy Robertson admitted that his side faces an uphill battle in the Premier League title race after their loss to Manchester City. Liverpool have already lost five matches in the Premier League this season.

Match our desperation with honest intent: Sandesh Jhingan pleads for restart of ISL India defender Sandesh Jhingan has urged football authorities to expedite the start of the Indian Super League season, saying players are "desperate" to return to action. In a social media statement, he said footballers are united and ready to play immediately.

England's Bazball approach evolving from reckless and entertaining: Ben Duckett England's Ben Duckett is saying that the Bazball approach is evolving ahead of the all-important Ashes series. England have adopted an ultra-aggressive approach since Brendon McCullum took over as the coach of the Test team.

Ashes: Australia's Mitchell Starc calls for spicy wickets over five-day Tests Australia pacer Mitchell Starc has called on curators to prepare lively, bowler-friendly pitches for the upcoming Ashes series, stressing that financial motives to stretch matches to five days should not influence pitch preparation.

IND vs SA: No rank turner requested by India for Eden Gardens opener, says Ganguly Sourav Ganguly confirmed that India has not sought a turning track for the Eden Gardens Test against South Africa, with the pitch expected to be a sporting surface offering balanced assistance to both batters and bowlers.

CSK send birthday wishes to Sanju Samson ahead of imminent trade: More power to you Amid all the trade rumours, CSK decided to send their birthday wishes to Sanju Samson ahead of the imminent move, which will see the Indian wicketkeeper-batter join the Chennai-base franchise.

Cena wins IC title for 1st time, finally becomes grand slam champion John Cena has won the WWE Intercontinental title for the very first time by defeating Dominik Mysterio on the November 10 episode of RAW. The win helped Cena complete the Grand Slam in WWE and join an elite list of stars.

Samrat Rana becomes India's first world champion in 10m air pistol Samrat Rana became India's first world champion in the men's 10m air pistol event, claiming gold at the ISSF World Championships in Cairo. The 20-year-old from Karnal shot 243.7 in a tense final to edge out China's Hu Kai (243.3) and deliver a landmark victory for Indian shooting.

Kolkata Police tighten security for India, South Africa teams after Delhi blastThe Kolkata Police have beefed up security arrangements for the Indian and South African teams ahead of the first Test at Eden Gardens, scheduled to begin on 14 November, following a high-intensity blast in Delhi.

Gautam Gambhir leads Indian cricket fraternity in mourning Delhi blast victimsIndia head coach Gautam Gambhir led the cricket fraternity in mourning the victims of the Red Fort car blast, expressing grief and prayers for their families. BCCI President Mithun Manhas and former India opener Shikhar Dhawan also poured in condolences.

Security tightened at Arun Jaitley Stadium for Ranji Trophy after Delhi blastA powerful blast near Delhi's Red Fort killed at least 8 people and injured several others. Ajinkya Naik re-elected as Mumbai Cricket president; elections set for other postsAjinkya Naik has been re-elected unopposed as the President of the Mumbai Cricket Association after all seven rival candidates withdrew their nominations. The MCA elections for other key posts will be held on Wednesday.

Don't see any reason why Mohammed Shami can't play for India: Sourav GangulySourav Ganguly has voiced strong support for Mohammed Shami's fitness and selection in the Indian cricket team amid reports of communication between the fast bowler and selectors.

Shreyas Iyer, back from life-threatening injury, shares beach photo: GratefulIndia cricketer Shreyas Iyer shared a photo of himself holidaying at a beach, marking his first public appearance since recovering from a life-threatening injury. The batter suffered a lacerated spleen during a diving effort in the third ODI in Sydney, required urgent medical attention, and is currently recovering under medical supervision.

Did Gautam Gambhir take a dig at Rohit,Virat with not celebrating series losses claim?India head coach Gautam Gambhir states he never celebrates series losses as a coach. His comments have sparked debate among fans who're seeing it as an attack on Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli.

Sanju Samson won't captain CSK in IPL 2026 if Jadeja trade goes through: R AshwinIPL 2026 retentions: Former India spinner R Ashwin has said Sanju Samson may not lead Chennai Super Kings next year even if the trade involving Ravindra Jadeja goes through. Ashwin also believes Jadeja joining Rajasthan Royals would be a major boost for the 2008 champions.

Fit Rohit must now prove himself by scoring 600 runs like Kohli in IPL: KaifMohammad Kaif feels Mumbai Indians opener Rohit Sharma must prove himself by scoring 600 runs in the upcoming IPL season, having undergone sensational fitness transformation recently.

Lionel Messi secretly visits former home Camp Nou: FC Barcelona fans get emotionalLionel Messi quietly visited his old home at Camp Nou and shared how deeply he misses Barcelona. He hinted at returning one day—not just to say farewell, but perhaps to reconnect in a new way.

Mohamed Salah slammed by Wayne Rooney after Liverpool's loss to Manchester CityWayne Rooney slammed Mohamed Salah after his poor performance in Liverpool's loss to Manchester City on Sunday, November 9. Salah has struggled for form this season as Liverpool's woes continue with the latest defeat.

Dhruv Jurel has the best technique to bat at no. 3: Former India wicketkeeperFormer India wicketkeeper Deep Dasgupta has identified Dhruv Jurel as possessing the best technique for India's unsettled No. 3 spot in Test cricket. Jurel has been in sensational form of late but his place in playing XI is under question with Rishabh Pant returning to the team.

Sunil Gavaskar warns India's Women's World Cup winners of PR traps: Don't get usedIndian cricket great Sunil Gavaskar has cautioned India's Women's World Cup winners to be wary of fake promises and opportunistic brands seeking publicity, reminding them not every post-victory reward or offer may materialise.

Batting order is overrated in T20Is, we need to evolve as coaches: Gautam GabmhirGautam Gambhir said India cannot afford to think traditionally in T20Is. The head coach said he wants a side where players move up and down the order, focus on impact, and are ready to play different roles in the lead-up to next year's T20 World Cup.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
